tagline: Plugins | Setup Oracle Spatial Database Plugin

mainContent.title: Plugins | Setup Oracle Spatial Database Plugin

sections.title: Windows (32-bit)
steps: Download Oracle Instant Client 32-bit for Windows (version ≤11.2.x) from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/winsoft-085727.html
(Note: You have to register to get Oracle Instant Client)
Version 11.2.0.3.0 (32-bit)
Instant Client Package - Basic: All files required to run OCI, OCCI, and JDBC-OIC applications
instantclient-basic-windows.x86-11.2.0.3.0.zip
Unzip the downloaded ZIP package to your local hard drive. For example: C:\instantclient_11_2
Setup your Windows system environment for Oracle Instant Client
Add the path of Oracle Instant Client to PATH system variable in "System Properties" dialog (see following example)
(Note: you need to add ; before the Oracle Path)
Restart GeoDa program, then you should be able to connect to the Oracle Spatial database by using GeoDa-Oracle-Plugin

sections.title: Mac OSX ≥10.6 (64-bit)
steps: Download Oracle Instant Client Package - Basic, 64-bit (version ≤11.2.x) from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/intel-macsoft-096467.html
(Note: You have to register to get Oracle Instant Client)
Version 11.2.0.3.0 (64-bit)
Instant Client Package - Basic: All files required to run OCI, OCCI, and JDBC-OIC applications
instantclient-basic-macosx.x64-11.2.0.3.0.zip
Unzip the downloaded ZIP package to your local hard drive. For example: /Users/yourname/Downloads/instantclient_11_2
Open a new terminal, run the following 2 commands to configure Oracle client for GeoDa
export ORACLE_HOME=/Users/yourname/Downloads/instantclient_11_2
./install_plugins.sh /path/to/downloaded_GeoDa.app/
The command in the first line stores the Oracle Instant Client location to a variable ORACLE_HOME.
The command in the second line updates the configuration of the Oracle Plugin for GeoDa.
Restart the GeoDa program, then you should be able to connect to the Oracle Spatial database using the GeoDa-Oracle-Plugin

sections.title: Ubuntu ≥12 (32-bit)
steps: Download Oracle Instant Client 32-bit (version ≤11.2.x) from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/linuxsoft-082809.html
(Note: You have to register to get Oracle Instant Client)
Version 11.2.0.3.0 (32-bit)
Instant Client Package - Basic: All files required to run OCI, OCCI, and JDBC-OIC applications
instantclient-basic-linux-11.2.0.3.0.zip
Unzip the downloaded ZIP package to your local hard drive. For example: /home/yourname/Downloads/instantclient_11_2
Setup your Ubuntu system environment for Oracle Instant Client
Run the following command in a terminal (Note: remember to replace "yourname" )
echo "export ORACLE_HOME=/home/yourname/Downloads/instantclient_11_2" >> ~/.bashrc
Restart the GeoDa program, then you should be able to connect to the Oracle Spatial database using the GeoDa-Oracle-Plugin
